meanings.definition: A hole or pit in a road surface caused by wear or weathering.
meanings.sent1: The car hit a pothole and got a flat tire.
meanings.sent2: Be careful when driving to avoid hitting a pothole.
meanings.sent3: Why did the pothole bring a shovel to the party? To dig deeper into the conversation!
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a pothole, full of unexpected bumps and holes.
meanings.sent5: The pothole on the street was so deep that it seemed bottomless.

meanings.definition: To make a hole or pit in a road surface.
meanings.sent1: The workers had to pothole the road to fix the drainage system.
meanings.sent2: Please don't pothole the driveway while trying to install the new mailbox.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally potholed the sidewalk while attempting to plant a tree.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to pothole his confidence, leaving him unsure of himself.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rain can pothole the dirt road, making it difficult to drive on.
